basicInfo.notes: Founded in 2004 as Hosting Media, rebranded to Hostinger in 2011. Headquarters in Kaunas/Vilnius, Lithuania. Employee-owned company with ~1,000 employees. Parent of Hosting24, Zyro, Niagahoster, and 000webhost. Offices in Lithuania, Indonesia (Yogyakarta), and Brazil (Florianopolis). Private equity firm ConHostinger acquired ~31% controlling stake in 2021.

pricing.moneyBackExclusions: Domains non-refundable; Setup fees non-refundable; Redemption fees non-refundable; Third-party services non-refundable

policiesOverages.accountSuspensionPolicy: Abuse detection leads to immediate suspension; phishing/malware results in account termination
policiesOverages.resourceAbuseDefinition: Exceeding inode limits; excessive CPU/memory usage; hosting prohibited content; cryptocurrency mining
policiesOverages.hiddenFeesNotes: Setup fee $4.99 on monthly plans; Email accounts limited to 2 free (1 year only) as of Dec 2025; Renewal prices 5-6x higher than promo; No Node.js on shared hosting; SSH requires Premium+ plan; Priority support only on Cloud plans

business.affiliateCommissionAmount: 40-60% commission; 30-day cookie; $100 min payout (PayPal), $500 (bank); no commission on 1-month plans or renewals

editorial.knownIssues: Renewal prices 5-6x higher than promo ($1.99 â†’ $10.99); No phone support; SSH only on Premium+ plans; No Node.js on shared hosting; Email accounts reduced to 2 free (Dec 2025); Sitejabber rating only 2.7/5; Some suspension/abuse department complaints; TTFB can spike to 1.3s during peak hours
editorial.bestFor: Budget beginners; WordPress sites needing LiteSpeed; Users wanting free unlimited migrations; International users (11 data center locations); AI website builder users; Adult content sites (within legal limits)
editorial.avoidIf: Need phone support; Need Node.js on shared hosting; Enterprise compliance (no SOC2/HIPAA); Budget-conscious at renewal time; Need many email accounts; Prefer cPanel over proprietary panels
editorial.competitorComparisonNotes: Cheapest promo pricing vs GoDaddy/Namecheap; LiteSpeed included (GoDaddy/Namecheap don't have); Better uptime (99.9%+) than budget competitors; More data centers (11) than Namecheap (4); No cPanel (uses hPanel); Higher renewal markup than Namecheap; Free unlimited migrations beats both competitors

comparisonData.uniqueSellingPoint: Cheapest premium hosting with LiteSpeed, 11 data centers, and AI website builder
comparisonData.idealCustomerProfile: Budget beginner wanting modern performance features without technical complexity

faqContent.faqIsThisHostGood: Hostinger is excellent for beginners and bloggers wanting cheap, fast hosting with LiteSpeed, but renewal prices are 5-6x higher.
faqContent.faqWhoOwnsThisHost: Hostinger is employee-owned, headquartered in Lithuania. ConHostinger acquired a 31% controlling stake in 2021.
faqContent.faqHowMuchDoesItCost: Hostinger shared hosting starts at $1.99/month (promo) and renews at $10.99/month. First year costs approximately $29 including setup fee.
faqContent.faqIsItBeginnerFriendly: Yes, Hostinger's hPanel is very intuitive with an AI website builder, making it one of the most beginner-friendly hosts.
faqContent.faqDoesItIncludeEmail: Yes, but limited to 2 free email accounts (1 year only as of December 2025).
faqContent.faqCanIHostWordPress: Yes, Hostinger offers optimized WordPress hosting with LiteSpeed cache, staging, and auto-updates.
faqContent.faqWhatsTheUptime: Hostinger guarantees 99.9% uptime with SLA credits for downtime.
faqContent.faqCanICancelAnytime: Yes, with a 30-day money-back guarantee. Domains and setup fees are non-refundable.
